attributes.action: Legalise LSD and magic mushrooms small amounts for medical and recreational use
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mensjournal.com/health-fitness/health/lsds-health-benefits-20130826

http://www.medicaldaily.com/how-magic-mushrooms-enlighten-brain-and-improve-psychiatric-conditions-311126

They have lots of benefits and medically legalising small amounts would not encourage it's use since very few people use it.

Psychedelics are non addictive and scientists have even said that banning psychedelics are against human rights.
attributes.background: Albert Hoffman discovered LSD in 1938, used it a few times and lived as long as 102. Magic Mushrooms have been used for thousands of years and have always been considered safe. There have been studies which prove these are the safest drugs, safer than alcohol, tobacco and even cannabis.
